page.title: 15WHITEHAVEN COASTGUARD.
page.content: Whitehaven is the second oldest Coastguard Station in Britain.It was started in 1822.Mr Russell, who is the Sector Officer, has to cover an area from Millom to Annan and is helped by 70 Auxiliaries.The danger areas are St Bees Head and St Bees cliffs.The busiest time of year for a Coastguard is in Summer because people go swimming and get carried out to sea by the current at St Bees.Our Coastguard still uses a Breeches Buoy and goes for practices off St Bees Cliffs.Our Coastguard also has certificates from the R.S.P.B and from the R.S.P.C.A for saving dogs,cats,seagulls and many more animals.He is also responsible for stranded whales,obnoxious waste,oil pollution and the safety of buildings on the foreshore.
